document.docAuthor: Qin, Yanyan, Liu, Xianwei & Li, Kai
document.docTitle: Tachycines Qin, Liu & Li, 2019, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Review of the subgenus Tachycines (Gymnaeta) Adelung, 1902 (Orthoptera, Rhaphidophoridae, Aemodogryllinae, Aemodogryllini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the subgenus Tachycines (Gymnaeta) Adelung, 1902 (Orthoptera, Rhaphidophoridae, Aemodogryllinae, Aemodogryllini)

heading.emphasis:
Key to the species of subgenus ( Gymnaeta ) genus
Tachycines

treatment.paragraph: 1(26) Hind metatarsus with bristles beneath.
2(7) Supra internal spur of hind tibiae almost exceeding ventral apex of hind metatarsus.

3(4) Hind tibiae above on each side with less than 50 spines.............................. T .
( G .) tonkinensis Chopard, 1929
4(3) Hind tibiae above on each side with more than 50 spines.

5(6) Dorsal surface of body without longitudinal band; male genitalia as Figs. 3–4 ; female subgenital plate as
Fig. 5............................................................................. T
.
( G .) gonggashanicus (
Zhang & Liu, 2009
)

6(5) Dorsal surface of body with light longitudinal band; male genitalia as Fig. 7 ; female subgenital plate as
Fig. 8........................................................................................ T
.
( G .) brevicaudus Karny, 1934
7(2) Supra internal spur of hind tibiae not exceeding ventral apex of hind metatarsus.
8(13) Internal genicular lobe of fore femur without spine; hind tibiae above on each side with more than 50 spines.

9(10) Subgenital plate of female transverse ( Fig. 11 ); male genitalia as
Fig. 10......... T
.
( G .) wuyishanicus (
Zhang & Liu, 2009
)
10(9) Subgenital plate of female not transverse.

11(12) Subgenital plate of female as long as wide ( Fig. 15 ); male genitalia as
Figs. 13–14................. T
.
( G .) parvus
sp. nov.

12(11) Subgenital plate of female distinctly longer than wide ( Fig. 17 )................. T .
( G .) longilaminus (
Zhang & Liu, 2009
)
13(8) Internal genicular lobe of fore femur with a short spine; hind tibiae above on each side with less than 50 spines.
14(19) Fore and mid tibiae beneath with spurs.
15(18) Mid tibiae beneath with 1–2 external spurs and 1 internal spur; 3–8th abdominal sternites with cone-like projections.

16(17) Eyes somewhat reduced ( Fig.18 ); epiphallus of male as
Fig. 20............... T
.
( G .) semicrenatus (
Gorochov et al. , 2006
)

17(16) Eyes well developed; epiphallus of male as
Fig. 21.............................. T
.
( G .) chenhui (
Rampini et al. , 2008
)

18(15) Mid tibiae beneath with 1 internal spur only; 3–8th abdominal sternites without cone-like projections................................................................................................. T.
( G .) cuenoti Chopard, 1929
19(14) Fore and mid tibiae beneath without spurs.

20(21) Eyes less reduced; female subgenital plate as
Fig. 27........................... T
.
( G .) caudatus (
Gorochov et al. , 2006
)
21(20) Eyes strongly reduced.
22(25) Eyes presented by a line.

23(24) Hind tibiae above on each side with 26–39 spines............................. T .
( G .) proximus (
Gorochov et al. , 2006
)

24(23) Hind tibiae above on each side with 9–11 spines............................. T .
( G .) ferecaecus (
Gorochov et al. , 2006
)
26(1) Hind metatarsus keeled beneath.
27(68) Supra internal spur of hind tibiae not exceeding ventral apex of hind metatarsus.
28(51) Hind tibiae above on each side with 50–90 spines.
30(37) Body unicolor; frons without dark longitudinal bands.
31(34) Epiphallus of male A-shaped.

32(33) Male genitalia as Figs. 36–37 ; female subgenital plate as
Fig. 38.................... T
.
( G .) beresowskii ( Adelung, 1902 )

33(32) Male genitalia as Fig. 39 ; female subgenital plate as
Fig. 40......................... T
.
( G .) belousovi (Gorochov, 2010)
34(31) Epiphallus of male not A-shaped.

37(30) Body light brown, mottled with dark blotches; frons with 2 dark longitudinal bands ( Fig. 48 ); male genitalia as
Figs. 49–50 T
.
( G .) lushuicus
sp. nov.

39(40) Epiphallus of male distinctly transverse ( Fig. 52 ).................................. T .
( G .) bifurcatus (Gorochov, 2010)
40(39) Epiphallus of male not transverse.
41(46) Subgenital plate of female with triangular median lobe.

42(43) Epiphallus of male nearly rectangular............................................. T .
( G .) racovitzai Chopard, 1915
43(42) Epiphallus of male H-shaped.

44(45) Male genitalia as Fig. 55 ; female subgenital plate as
Fig. 56...................... T
.
( G .) solidus (
Gorochov et al. , 2006
)

45(44) Male genitalia as Fig. 57 ; female subgenital plate as
Fig. 58....................... T
.
( G .) latellai (
Rampini et al. , 2008
)
46(41) Subgenital plate of female with rounded median lobe.

47(48) Body unicolor; male genitalia as Figs. 59–60 ; female subgenital plate as
Fig. 61.............. T
.
( G .) yueyangensis
sp. nov.
48(47) Body light brown, mottled with dark blotches.

49(50) Apex of female subgenital plate bluntly projected ( Fig. 63 )........................... T .
( G .) latus (
Zhang & Liu, 2009
)

50(49) Apex of female subgenital plate bluntly truncate ( Fig. 65 )........................ T .
( G .) roundatus (
Zhang & Liu, 2009
)
51(28) Hind tibiae above on each side with 30–50 spines.
52(57) Fore femur about 2.4–2.5 times longer than the pronotum.

53(54) Abdominal sternites with short ventral projections; male genitalia as
Fig. 66........... T
.
( G .) zorzini (
Rampini et al. , 2008
)
54(53) Abdominal sternites without ventral projections.

55(56) Male genitalia as Figs. 69–70 ; subgenital plate of female as
Fig. 71................... T
.
( G .) borutzkyi ( Gorochov, 1994 )

56(55) Male genitalia as Figs. 73–74 ; subgenital plate of female as
Fig. 75................................. T
.
( G .) lii
sp. nov.
57(52) Fore femur about 2.0–2.2 times longer than the pronotum.

58(59) Body larger (hind femur longer than 20mm ); epiphallus of male as
Fig. 76................ T
.
( G .) coomani Chopard, 1929

60(61) Fore tibiae beneath with 2 external spurs and 2 internal spurs; male genitalia as
Fig. 80.......... T
.
( G .) dianxicus
sp. nov.
61(60) Fore tibiae beneath with 1–2 external spurs and 1 internal spur.

62(63) Epiphallus of male nearly H-shaped ( Fig. 82 ); subgenital plate of female as
Fig. 84....... T
.
( G .) cavernus (
Jiao et al. , 2008
)
63(62) Epiphallus of male genitalia nearly subquadrate.

64(65) Apex of subgenital plate of female notched; male genitalia as
Figs. 85–86.................... T
.
( G .) bruneri Karny, 1934
65(64) Apex of subgenital plate of female blunt.

66(67) Male genitalia as Fig. 90 ; subgenital plate of female as
Fig. 91................................ T
.
( G .) pallidus
sp. nov.

67(66) Male genitalia as Fig. 92 ; subgenital plate of female as
Fig. 93...................... T
.
( G .) sonlaensis (Gorochov, 1990)
68(27) Supra internal spur of hind tibiae almost exceeding ventral apex of hind metatarsus.
70(73) Hind tibiae above on each side with 70–90 spines.
73(70) Hind tibiae above on each side with 50–70 spines.

74(75) Hind tibiae above on each side with 61–67 spines; male genitalia as
Figs. 101–102................. T
.
( G .) dispar
sp. nov.

75(74) Hind tibiae above on each side with 50–51 spines; male genitalia as
Figs. 105–106.................. T
.
( G .) verus
sp. nov.
77(82) Epiphallus of male A-shaped.
78(81) Fore tibiae beneath with 2 external spurs and 2 internal spurs.

80(79) Male genitalia as Fig. 108 ; subgenital plate of female as
Fig. 109....................... T
.
( G .) longicaudus Karny, 1934

81(78) Fore tibiae beneath with 2 external spurs and 1 internal spur; male genitalia as
Fig. 110..... T
.
( G .) kabaki (Gorochov, 2010)
82(77) Epiphallus of male not A-shaped.
83(86) Epiphallus of male nearly triangular.
86(83) Epiphallus of male not triangular-shaped.
